name: PM-KISAN (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi)
description: Direct income support of ₹6,000 per year to farmer families.
benefits: ₹6,000 per year in 3 equal installments of ₹2,000 each.
Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) directly to bank accounts.
Financial supplement for procuring agricultural inputs and domestic needs.
eligibility: All landholding farmer families with cultivable land.
Excludes high economic status categories (Ministers, Mayors, etc.).
process: Apply online via PM-KISAN portal (Farmer Corner > New Farmer Registration) or visit Common Service Centres (CSCs). e-KYC is mandatory.

name: PMFBY (Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana)
description: Comprehensive crop insurance scheme providing financial support to farmers suffering crop loss/damage.
benefits: Insurance coverage against crop loss due to natural calamities, pests & diseases.
Stabilizes income and encourages innovative agricultural practices.
Low premium rates (1.5% for Rabi, 2% for Kharif, 5% for Horticulture) with government subsidy.
eligibility: Farmers growing notified crops in notified areas.
Sharecroppers and tenant farmers are eligible.
Voluntary for all farmers (loanee and non-loanee).
process: Apply apply online via PMFBY portal or through banks/CSCs/Insurance Intermediaries within the cut-off date.

name: Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF)
description: Financing facility for post-harvest management infrastructure.
benefits: Loans with interest subvention of 3% per annum up to ₹2 Crore.
Credit guarantee coverage for loans up to ₹2 Crore.
Moratorium for repayment up to 2 years.
process: Register and apply on the National Agriculture Infra Financing Facility (NAIFF) portal.

name: e-NAM (National Agriculture Market)
description: Pan-India electronic trading portal for farm produce.
benefits: Unified market for agricultural commodities.
Better price discovery through transparent online bidding.
Real-time payments to farmers.
Access to more buyers/traders.
eligibility: Farmers with valid bank account and mobile number.
process: Register via e-NAM portal or mobile app, or visit the nearest Mandi registration counter.

name: Soil Health Card Scheme
description: Crop-wise fertilizer recommendations for better yields.
benefits: Information on soil nutrient status (12 parameters).
Fertilizer dosage recommendations for specific crops.
Improves soil health and reduces cultivation cost.
process: Soil samples collected by State Government officials. Cards distributed to farmers based on test results.

name: PMKSY (Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana)
description: Irrigation coverage to improve water use efficiency ('Per Drop More Crop').
benefits: Subsidy on micro-irrigation systems (Drip/Sprinkler).
Assured irrigation (Har Khet Ko Pani).
Improved water use efficiency.
eligibility: Farmers with land ownership and water source availability.
process: Apply through the state agriculture/horticulture department website or local office.

name: Kisan Credit Card (KCC)
description: Credit support to farmers for cultivation and other needs.
benefits: Short-term credit for crop cultivation.
Flexible repayment schedule.
Crop insurance coverage.
ATM-enabled RuPay Debit Card.
eligibility: All farmers (Owner cultivators, Tenant farmers, Sharecroppers).
process: Visit the nearest bank branch to apply or apply online via bank websites.

name: Jaivik Kheti (Organic Farming)
description: Promotion of organic farming and certification.
benefits: Financial assistance for organic inputs.
PGS Certification support.
Marketing support for organic produce.
eligibility: Farmers willing to adopt organic farming in clusters (PKVY).
process: Register under PKVY scheme through Regional Councils or State Department of Agriculture.

name: ATMA (Agricultural Technology Management Agency)
benefits: Latest agricultural technology dissemination.
Training and exposure visits for farmers.
Farm schools and demonstrations.
eligibility: All farmers interested in new technologies.
process: Contact local Block Technology Manager or Agriculture Dept office.

name: MIDH (Integrated Development of Horticulture)
description: Holistic growth of the horticulture sector.
benefits: Subsidy for setting up new orchards/gardens.
Support for Polyhouses and Greenhouses.
Cold storage and post-harvest management support.
eligibility: Farmers, FPOs, SHGs involved in horticulture.
process: Apply to State Horticulture Mission or National Horticulture Board.
